question:
The core of Jaina doctrine is expressed in which of the following principles?
1. Anekantavada
2. Syadavada
3. Nayavada
4. Pancha Mahavrata
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: The core of Jaina doctrine is expressed in the following principles: (1) Anekantavada (doctrine of manifold nature of reality), (2) Syadavada (the theory of conditioned predication), (3) Nayavada (theory of partial standpoints), (4) Triratna (three gems), (5) Pancha Mahavrata (five great vows), and (6) Ahimsa (doctrine of non-violence).
